0.cdata!:
Haiti - Projet de Controle
            d'Influenza Avaire en Haiti, Preparation et Response a
            la Pandemie Humaine : plan de gestion environnementale

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objectives are to minimize
            the threat posed by AHI infection and other diseases for the
            poultry sector and humans, and to prepare for, control, and
            respond to influenza pandemics and other infectious disease
            emergencies as they may occur. The project aims to support
            the implementation of preventive measures and strengthening
            infrastructure for early detection and rapid response to
            health emergencies constituted by the highly pathogenic
            avian influenza (HPAI). The initial focus of activities is
            on animal health and emergency animal health preparedness
            and prevention activities, and capacity building at multiple
            levels in several key areas (laboratory facilities and
            community-based interventions), with some limited actions
            concerning human health. This project is expected to
            contribute to minimizing or mitigating the impacts of an
            unchecked Avian-Human Influenza (AHI) outbreak and help
            avert a human pandemic, through the development of a viable
            and effective reporting and response mechanisms. It is not
            expected to have any large-scale, significant, or
            irreversible impacts, as it is focused largely on capacity
            building and the strengthening of emergency preparedness,
            readiness and response to AHI.
